meanings.definition: The division of an area into zones.
meanings.sent1: The zonations in the city help organize different types of businesses.
meanings.sent2: Urban planning involves careful consideration of zonations to ensure efficient land use.
meanings.sent3: At the school fair, the zonations for food stalls made it easy for students to find their favorite snacks.
meanings.sent4: In the library, the zonations of books created a sense of order and calm.
meanings.sent5: The zonations of the garden, with flowers in one area and vegetables in another, made it visually appealing.

meanings.definition: The arrangement or distribution of organisms into distinct zones.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the zonations of plants in different climate regions.
meanings.sent2: The zonations of marine life vary depending on the depth of the ocean.
meanings.sent3: During the nature hike, we observed the zonations of birds in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The zonations of animals in the savanna reflect their adaptation to the environment.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the zonations of insects in the rainforest revealed a diverse ecosystem.
